column1: Owensboro is a home rule-class city in and the county seat of Daviess County
column2: Kentucky
column3: United States. It is the fourth-largest city in the state by population. Owensboro is located on U.S. Route 60 and Interstate 165 about 107 miles (172 km) southwest of Louisville
column4: and is the principal city of the Owensboro metropolitan area. The 2010 census had its population at 57
column5: 265. The metropolitan population was estimated at 116
column6: 506. The metropolitan area is the sixth largest in the state as of 2018

column3: downtown Owensboro was the site of the last public hanging in the United States. A 26 year old African American man
column4: Rainey Bethea
column5: was convicted and sentenced for the rape and murder of 70-year-old Lischa Edwards in a very short time (only 37 days lapsed between the crime and the execution). A carnival atmosphere was in place with vendors selling hotdogs
column6: attended by a large crowd including children and many reporters. The execution was presided over by a female sheriff
column8: who gained national media attention for her role in the process
column9: although she declined to spring the trap. Before Bethea was dead
column10: the crowd had already begun to tear at his clothes and even his body for souvenirs. column1: Pinkerton Tobacco produced Red Man chewing tobacco in Owensboro. Swedish Match continues to make Red Man in a plant outside city limits.The Owensboro Wagon Company
column2: established in 1884
column3: was one of the largest and most influential wagon companies in the nation. With eight styles or sizes of wagons
column4: the company set the standard of quality at the turn of the 20th century.

column1: Frederick A. Ames came to Owensboro from Washington
column2: Pennsylvania
column3: in 1887. He started the Carriage Woodstock Company to repair horse-drawn carriages. In 1910
column4: he began to manufacture a line of automobiles under the Ames brand name. Ames hired industrialist Vincent Bendix in 1912
column5: and the company became the Ames Motor Car Company. Despite its product being called the "best $1500" car by a Texas car dealer
column6: the company ceased production of its own model in 1915. The company then began manufacturing replacement bodies for the more widely sold Ford Model T. In 1922
column7: the company remade itself and started to manufacture furniture under the name Ames Corporation. The company finally sold out to Whitehall Furniture in 1970.The start of the Kentucky Electrical Lamp Company
column8: a light bulb manufacturing company was in 1899; it eventually was acquired by Kentucky Radio Company (Ken-Rad) in 1918 and later acquired by General Electric in 1945 and in 1987 acquired by MPD
column10: created the light bulbs that illuminated the first night game in the history of Major League Baseball on May 24

column13: producing both receiving types and military/industrial ceramic types. In 1961
column14: engineers at the General Electric plant in Owensboro introduced a family of vacuum tubes called the Compactron.

column2: John G. Barnard founded the Modern Welding Company in a small building located near the Ohio River at First and Frederica Streets where the Commonwealth of Kentucky office building sits today. Today
column3: Modern Welding Company has nine steel tank and vessel fabrication subsidiaries located throughout the United States
column4: and five welding supply stores located in Kentucky and Indiana. The company is the country's largest supplier of underground and aboveground steel storage tanks for flammable and combustible liquids. column1: Owensboro has operated under a City Manager form of government since 1954. Citizens elect a mayor and four city commissioners who form the Board of Commissioners. The Board of Commissioners is the legislative body of the city government and represents the interests of the citizens. The Board of Commissioners hires a city manager who administers the day-to-day operations of the city.
The mayor is elected for a term of four years. Each city commissioner is elected for a term of two years. The term of the city manager is indefinite and based on performance.

column2: Daviess County Public Schools
column3: and the Diocese of Owensboro's Catholic School System oversee K-12 education in and around Owensboro.
